Principal Investigator.name: Jonathan C. Lau, MD, PhD, FRCSC
Principal Investigator.position: Assistant Professor of Neurosurgery, Western University
Principal Investigator.bio: Jonathan Lau is an MD and PhD trained neurosurgeon and researcher in the Department of Clinical Neurological Sciences at Western University with cross-appointments to Biomedical Engineering and Neuroscience. He runs the AIMS lab at Western University focussed on using anatomy and informatics approaches to improve modulation and surgery in the clinical neurosciences. He is a certified Fellow of the Royal College of Surgeons of Canada (FRCSC) and received the Royal College Detweiler traveling scholarship to complete further subspecialty training at Emory University in epilepsy as well as stereotactic and functional neurosurgery. His research focuses on acquiring and leveraging multimodal datasets (imaging and electrophysiology), with the goal of offering increasingly focal treatment options that maximize benefit while minimizing side effects.

Post Docs.name: Diego B. Piza, MD, PhD
Post Docs.supervisor: Co-supervised by Dr. Terry Peters & Dr. Julio Martinez-Trujillo
Post Docs.bio: Diego's research is broadly centred on leveraging electrophysiology, data science and systems neuroscience to help understand brain function in health and disease.

PhD Students.name: Alaa Taha
PhD Students.bio: Alaa's current research interests revolve around improving the accuracy and efficacy of neurosurgical interventions using ultra-high field imaging (>= 7-Tesla) and AI.

PhD Students.name: Violet Liu
PhD Students.bio: Violet's research interests include cross-modality characterization of the human subcortex for neurosurgical targeting, visualization via ultra-high field MRI, and diffusion MRI.

PhD Students.name: Mohamad Ali Kesserwan
PhD Students.bio: Mohamad completed his Bachelor of Science with specialization in Human Biology from the University of Toronto. He then completed his Doctor of Medicine at McMaster Univerity, where he is currently completing his residency in Neurosurgery. Through McMaster's Clinician Investigator Program, Mohamad was able to join our lab to pursue a doctorate in computational neuroscience. Mohamad is particularly interested in advancing brain-machine interfaces to empower patients with neurological disabilities.

Masters Students.name: Dilyar Deniz
Masters Students.bio: Hi! I'm a Master's student in the AIMS lab and is researching applications of dMRI on epilepsy. Specifically, I'm using dMRI to map out the limbic circuit reliably.

Lab Members.name: Mackenzie Snyder
Lab Members.bio: I am a research software developer co-op student in the lab and I am a biomedical engineering undergraduate student from the University of Waterloo. My work in the lab consists of assisting and contributing to various lab software projects in the field of computational neuro imaging.

Lab Members.name: Dhananjhay Bansal (Djay)
Lab Members.bio: I am a junior astrophysicist turned research software engineer with experience developing telescope software (CASTOR, HIRAX). Now focused on computational neuroscience, I work on various neuroimaging projects at Robarts Research Institute, including AutoAFIDs and HippUnfold, building research-driven software tools.

Lab Members.name: Arun Thurairajah
Lab Members.department: London Health Sciences Centre/Robarts Research Institute
Lab Members.supervisor: Dr. Jonathan Lau and Dr. Ali Khan
Lab Members.bio: I finished my Master's in Neuroscience with the AIMs and Khan Labs in 2024, where I used deep learning to segment intracranial electrode contacts from post-operative imaging. I currently support intraoperative neurophysiological monitoring for Deep Brain Stimulation at LHSC.

Lab Members.name: Milad Khaki, PhD
Lab Members.department: London Health Sciences Centre / Western University
Lab Members.supervisor: Dr. Jonathan Lau and Dr. Lyle Muller
Lab Members.bio: I am a research data scientist working at the intersection of neuroscience and data infrastructure. At LHSC, I support SEEG research and clinical workflows by developing scalable pipelines for data anonymization, format conversion, validation, and archival. My background and interest also extends to application of NLP, LLM, and deep learning models in clinical applications, as well as hardware integration for patient recording systems.

Lab Members.name: Homa Vahidi
Lab Members.position: Former Lab Manager and Current Research Associate
Lab Members.department: London Health Sciences Centre / Western University
Lab Members.supervisor: Dr. Jonathan Lau and Dr. Emma Duerden
Lab Members.bio: I am the AIMS lab former lab manager and I continue to collaborate with the AIMS lab on several clinical and basic-science projects. I am currently a MD student at Stanford University.

Lab Members.name: Joy Zhao
Lab Members.bio: I am recent graduate from Western’s Medical Sciences program (physiology specialization with Scholar’s Elective program) and will be beginning medical school in fall 2025. Currently, I’m working on an AFIDs project to increase the accuracy of image registration quality control and improve the standardization of neuroimaging workflows. My research interests are in neuroimaging, neurodegenerative diseases, and recently healthcare technology.

Lab Members.name: Wenyao Xia
Lab Members.supervisor: Dr. Jonathan Lau and Dr. Ali Khan
Lab Members.bio: I am the former collaborating post-doc associate on the 3D-2D cortical image registration project. My research interests include image processing, registration for surgical guidance, and image artifact removal

Lab Members.name: Feyi Ogunsanya
Lab Members.bio: I was a former medical biophysics undergraduate student in the AIMS Lab and researched MRI modality conversion. I did my Master’s in Computer Science at Georgia Tech, focusing on brain-computer interface research. I’m currently a Machine Learning Engineer at Waymo.
